description: From Middle English losenge, from Old French losenge (“rhombus”), from Old French *lose (“flag-stone”), from Vulgar Latin *lausa.

entries.meaning: (shapes, heraldry) A quadrilateral with sides of equal length (rhombus), having two acute and two obtuse angles.
examples: Synonyms: (informal) diamond, rhomb, (most common in mathematics) rhombus

entries.meaning: A small tablet (originally diamond-shaped) or medicated sweet used to ease a sore throat.

verbs.description: lozenge (third-person singular simple present lozenges, present participle lozenging, simple past and past participle lozenged)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To form into the shape of a lozenge.
(transitive) To mark or emblazon with a lozenge.
